Department of Information Technology and: The NYC Department of Information Technology and Telecommunications (DoITT) is responsible for maintaining the foundational IT infrastructure and systems that touch every aspect of City life from public safety to human services, from education to economic development crossing the full spectrum of governmental operations.
Department of City Planning: The Department of City Planning (DCP) is responsible for planning the growth of the City of New York to enhance quality of life for all New Yorkers. DCP promotes coordinated investments in infrastructure and services, provides analysis for the development of neighborhood-based plans, and supports resilient and sustainable communities across the five boroughs for a more equitable New York City.
Capital Planning: The Capital Planning division of City Planning is spearheading innovative approaches to interagency collaboration and strategic capital program development through the use of data and data visualization platforms.
